formdata.value: The vision aspires to achieve growth and leadership in the construction industry by prioritizing quality, safety, sustainability, and innovation, while consistently exceeding client expectations and building lasting structures that leave a positive legacy.

The mission focuses on delivering exceptional and innovative construction services that prioritize client satisfaction through quality craftsmanship, sustainability, community development, and fostering strong relationships, while ensuring a safe work environment for all employees.
1 To build a sustainable future by providing eco-friendly construction services using advanced technologies & resource management.
2 To deliver exceptional construction services, prioritizing client satisfaction through quality craftsmanship, timely execution, and innovative solutions.

formdata.value:
About Company
Leapfrog is on a mission to be a role model technology company. Since 2010, we have relentlessly worked on crafting better digital products with our team of superior engineers. We’re a full-stack company specializing in SaaS products and have served over 100 clients with our mastery of emerging technologies.

We’re thinkers and doers, creatives and coders, makers and builders— but most importantly, we are trusted partners with world-class engineers. Hundreds of companies in Boston, Seattle, Silicon Valley, and San Francisco choose us to gain speed, agility, quality, and stability, giving them an edge over their competitors.

About the Role
At Leapfrog, our mission is to be a role model technology company. We want to be trusted partners, world-class engineers, and craftspeople. We’ve crafted impactful software solutions for many industries and ecosystems.

Make architectural decisions in collaboration with technology experts, ensure proper technical documentation.
Pro-active involvement in project risk analysis and mitigation, continuously reviewing problems to determine the root cause in order to prevent them in the future.
Ensure scalability, performance, reliability, and security of the application.
Keep up with trends in the constantly evolving technology.
Gather and analyze business requirements, understand the business perspective of the client, and plan product roadmap in collaboration with the project manager and client.
Encourage, involve, motivate, and lead team members in learning and achieving project and departmental goals.
Identify training needs, organize, and coach team members on various aspects of their career growth.
Actively involved in ensuring implementation of organizational culture, process, and standards.
Job Requirements
Minimum 7 years of experience preferably for US-based clients. Prior experience leading a small team of dedicated engineers will be a plus.
An ideal candidate is someone who is multi-skilled and comfortable in both front-end and back-end technologies.
Desired skills required of a front-end developer are React and Tailwind.
Desired skills required of a back-end developer are Next and Supabase.
The candidate should be able to own a code base independently and proactively gather and clarify requirements from the client.
Encourage, involve, motivate, and lead team members in learning and achieving project and departmental goals.
Experience with Python, AWS, Azure, and CI/CD pipelines is a bonus.

formdata.value: Stone Laying Ceremony Marks Commencement of 132 kV Amarpur-Dhungesanghu

At the start of the eclipse, there should be some good clear skies in Mexico, but into Texas, Austin and Dallas are looking quite cloudy with an increasing threat of some severe weather.

For eastern areas of Texas, severe storms, including tornadoes, may actually impact travel here after the spectacle.

This severe weather could also affect Oklahoma and southern Arkansas, but further north in Arkansas, cloud cover is looking a little better up through Indiana, where there should be some decent clear skies.

By the time the eclipse reaches northern Indiana, Ohio and northeast portions of the US, overall there’ll generally be some clear spells but some high level cloud could locally be a bit thicker to obscure the Sun.

For eastern Canada, Maine and up to New Brunswick, the forecast is looking good with some cloudless skies.
